Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Boolean/IsDefined
Synopsis Test whether the value of an expression is defined.
Syntax Exp ?
Types
Exp Exp ?
T bool
Description If no exception is generated during the evaluation of Exp, the result is true. Otherwise, it is false.
Examples 
rascal>T = ("a" : 1, "b" : 2);
map[str, int]: ("b":2,"a":1)
rascal>T["b"]?
bool: true
rascal>T["c"]?
bool: false
rascal>L = [10, 20, 30];
list[int]: [10,20,30]
rascal>L[1]?
bool: true
rascal>L[5]?
bool: false
